assessmentQuestions.question: What is the name of the computer that controls the engine?
How are the flaps operated in the Da42/62?
What would you see on your PFD if your pitot tube were blocked by icing during a climb? (give hints if needed)
assessmentQuestions.answer: Airspeed indicator would show an increasing airspeed, and behave a bit like an altimeter

exerciseItems.criteria: Understands how to start the engine. Able to use flows, needing the checklist to complete forgotten items.
Maintain positive control of the aircraft, taxying no faster than 10kt (Check MFD groundspeed)
Continuous effort to maintain centerline, correct callouts, rotation at around Vr, climbout at 85-95kt, gear up at entering into IMC or insufficient runway to land back onto
Able to maintain +/- 15 degrees +/- 150ft by end of session
Able to maintain 30 degrees constant bank angle, level turn, and level off at target heading +/- 15 degrees, +/- 150ft
Able to maintain 45 degrees constant bank angle, level turn, and level off at target heading +/- 15 degrees, +/- 150ft
Able to maintain heading +/- 15degrees, level off at target altitude +/- 150ft
Recover at the continous stall horn, +/- 20 degrees, -100ft maximum.
Maintain blue line speed -0/+10 kt, S&L, shallow turns, +/- 10 degrees +/- 100ft
Follow guidance, maintain high speed descent in correct configuration, recover at target altitude and clean up, +/- 15 degrees, +/- 150ft
Follow instructions to get into proper configuration, stable approach at 90kt +/- 5kt
Understands how to stop the engine. Able to use flows, needing the checklist to complete forgotten items.

configuration.notes: Allow student to use checklist for startup, but encourage them to use flows. Allow student to choose airport if they want.

remedialExercises.remediation: Cold & Dark: single large circuit to land, shutdown (repeat until end of session)
Start on runway, depart, focus on practicing items

assessmentQuestions.question: What is Flexbox?
assessmentQuestions.answer: Flexbox is a CSS layout model optimized for designing complex layouts easily and predictably.

assessmentQuestions.question: Why use Flexbox?
assessmentQuestions.answer: It allows for alignment of elements in different directions and orders, and is responsive and adaptable.
